flawed_nl_solution:
1/6 * 240 students = <<1/6*240=1440>>1440 students. So 1440 students read three or more novels.
7/20 * 240 students = <<7/20*240=84>>84 students. So 84 students read two novels.
5/12 * 240 students = <<5/12*240=100>>100 students. So 100 students read a novel.
240 students - (1440 students + 84 students + 100 students) = 240 students - 1624 students = <<240-(1440+84+100)=-1384>>-1384 students. So -1384 students don't read novels.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 40, not 1440. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
